item.title: CV
item.description: pdf version Sergey Trofimov, Software Engineer, Berlin [ linkedin.com/in/sarg | github.com/sarg | sarg@sarg.org.ru ] Summary 2006-2010 perl webdev, 2010-present java webdev. I know java, kotlin, python, perl. Linux user since 2001, can do DevOps but nothing fancy. In Java I’ve worked mostly with Spring and Hibernate and now I prefer smaller hand-picked libraries. I like to “grok” things, follow best practices and try to keep things simple. I can work autonomously but it’s important for me to have like-minded colleagues for technical discussions.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! I am a software engineer who still is fascinated by technology even after 15 years of working with it. You can find my resume here. This website is my personal space where I document my little side projects. This site is built in Emacs org-mode then exported with ox-hugo and compiled by Hugo. The theme is slightly modified xmin. I’ve left detailed instructions how this blog is setted up here: “Making hugo powered blog in emacs".

item.title: Movies
item.description: Here is a list of movies that I’ve watched and rated. For better UX please look the list on TheMovieDB. This page is under construction. Title Overview Rating Tickled Journalist David Farrier stumbles upon a mysterious tickling competition online. As he delves deeper he comes up against fierce resistance, but that doesn’t stop him getting to the bottom of a story stranger than fiction.

item.title: Exporting watch list from TMDb
item.description: I keep list of movies I’ve watched on TheMovieDB. The service is great and I’ve used it for quite a long time (>700 movies in my list). I was using another service before, which unfortunately had closed without giving me a chance to export the data and I had to scrape my watchlist from google cache. To prevent that from happening again, I’ve exported my watchlist from TMDb and will use the service only as a secondary source with nice UI.

item.title: Books
item.description: .gr_grid_container { /* customize grid container div here. eg: width: 500px; */ } .gr_grid_book_container { /* customize book cover container div here */ float: left; width: 98px; height: 160px; padding: 0px 0px; overflow: hidden; } Sergey's bookshelf: read

item.title: Android apps that I use
item.description: My phone is running AOSP without google services and almost all of the applications I use come from F-Droid. Few exceptions are apps for paid services that I use and they are installed from Aurora Store. I use fdroidcl to install and update applications. Backup is covered in post “Backing up Android phone". I use syncthing to share a directory between my laptops and phone. I have “Password Store” files in the shared directory in case I need access to passwords on phone (rarely).

item.title: Backing up Android phone
item.description: One day my wife asked me to help her backup about 30Gb of photos from her android phone. At first we had tried to copy files over MTP (in Win10). This idea quickly showed its incapacity. You see, Win10 wants to be nice and tries to calculate ETA. But 30Gb is a lot of files and over MTP it takes one request per file to get its size. So, we waited half an hour while Win10 was preparing to start the transfer and I had aborted this madness.

item.title: Making hugo powered blog in emacs
item.description: Starting a blog this days couldn’t be easier. Ten simple steps to get started.

item.title: Exporting secrets from FreeOTP to Pass
item.description: I have broken my phone screen. Not a big deal but I use it for 2FA. While replacement is on the way I will extract credentials from FreeOTP and import them in password store. Be aware that it is completeley against the idea of 2FA, because now both password and otp are on the same device.

item.title: Get the brain off the instant gratification hook
item.description: It easily becomes automatic to check for notifications/new messages/new emails etc. To give my rational self some time to intercept compulsive behaviour I have made this elisp snippet.
